channel.title: Comments on: Tooting Your Own Horn From Alabama in the Middle of the Night, and Other Words of Wisdom for Women in IT
channel.description: Stellar Short Fiction by Women-Identified Writers Since 2010

item.title: By: Hardware, Software, and "Magic": Women in IT - Luna Station QuarterlyLuna Station Quarterly
item.dc:creator: Hardware, Software, and "Magic": Women in IT - Luna Station QuarterlyLuna Station Quarterly
item.description: […] This is Part 2 of an interview with my sister Cathy Amis Griffith who worked for Burroughs Business Machines in the 1970s. Part 1, “Tooting Your Own Horn From Alabama in the Middle of the Night,” can be found here. […]
item.content:encoded: […] This is Part 2 of an interview with my sister Cathy Amis Griffith who worked for Burroughs Business Machines in the 1970s.  Part 1, “Tooting Your Own Horn From Alabama in the Middle of the Night,” can be found here. […]
